title: Module 1: Enterprise Architecture - Hierarchical Design
note: Review the two-tier (collapsed core) and three-tier (core, distribution, access) hierarchical network design models. Discuss scalability, redundancy, and performance implications of each. The context is the CCNP ENCOR exam blueprint.

title: Spine-Leaf Architecture
note: Deep dive into the spine-leaf architecture for modern data centers. Explain how it provides high bandwidth, low latency, and predictable performance for east-west traffic flows.

title: SD-WAN and SD-Access
note: Introduce Cisco's Software-Defined Networking (SDN) solutions. Explain the concepts of SD-WAN for intelligent wide-area networking and SD-Access for policy-based automation in campus networks.

title: Module 2: Advanced Switching - STP Deep Dive
note: Go beyond basic STP. Cover the mechanics of RSTP (802.1w) for faster convergence and MSTP (802.1s) for load balancing across multiple VLANs.

title: STP Security and Optimization
note: Teach how to secure the STP topology using features like BPDU Guard, Root Guard, and Loop Guard. Discuss optimization techniques.

title: VTP and DTP
note: Cover VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) for centralized VLAN management and Dynamic Trunking Protocol (DTP) for trunk negotiation. Discuss best practices and security risks.

title: EtherChannel Configuration
note: Provide a detailed guide to configuring link aggregation with EtherChannel, covering both LACP and PAgP negotiation protocols and load-balancing algorithms.

title: First Hop Redundancy Protocols (FHRP)
note: Detail the configuration and operation of HSRP, VRRP, and GLBP for providing default gateway redundancy.

title: Module 3: Advanced Routing - EIGRP
note: Deep dive into EIGRP's DUAL algorithm. Explain Feasible Distance, Reported Distance, and the concepts of successor and feasible successor.

title: EIGRP Optimization
note: Cover manual route summarization, unequal-cost load balancing with `variance`, and stub routing.

title: OSPF: LSA Types
note: Provide a detailed breakdown of the common OSPF LSA types (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7) and the information they carry.

title: OSPF: Area Types
note: Explain OSPF area types: backbone, standard, stub, totally stubby, and Not-So-Stubby-Areas (NSSA).

title: OSPF: Multi-Area Configuration
note: Demonstrate how to configure a multi-area OSPF network, including summarization between areas.

title: Route Redistribution
note: Explain how to configure route redistribution between different routing protocols. Discuss seed metrics and administrative distance manipulation.

title: Controlling Redistribution with Route Maps
note: Introduce route maps to filter routes and modify their attributes during redistribution using `match` and `set` commands.

title: Introduction to BGP
note: Introduce BGP as the routing protocol of the internet. Explain Autonomous Systems (AS), eBGP vs. iBGP, and the concept of path attributes.

title: BGP Path Selection Algorithm
note: Detail the BGP best-path selection algorithm, covering Weight, Local Preference, AS_PATH, Origin, and MED.

title: Configuring BGP
note: Demonstrate how to configure eBGP and iBGP peerings and advertise networks into BGP.

title: Module 4: VPN Technologies - VRF-Lite
note: Introduce VRF (Virtual Routing and Forwarding) to create multiple virtual routers within a single physical router for network segmentation.

title: GRE Tunneling
note: Cover Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) for creating simple, unencrypted tunnels over an IP network.

title: DMVPN
note: Introduce Dynamic Multipoint VPN (DMVPN) as a scalable VPN solution using mGRE, NHRP, and IPsec.

title: IPsec Fundamentals
note: Explain the IPsec framework, including the roles of IKE, ESP, and AH for creating secure VPN tunnels.

title: Module 5: Infrastructure Security - AAA
note: Cover securing device management using the AAA framework with local authentication and centralized RADIUS/TACACS+.

title: Control Plane Policing (CoPP)
note: Introduce CoPP to protect the router's CPU from denial-of-service attacks by rate-limiting traffic.

title: Module 6: Network Assurance - Syslog and SNMP
note: Cover configuring devices to send logs to a Syslog server and using SNMP to poll devices for performance data.

title: NetFlow
note: Introduce NetFlow for collecting and analyzing IP traffic information for monitoring and security analysis.

title: SPAN/RSPAN
note: Cover Switched Port Analyzer (SPAN) and Remote SPAN (RSPAN) for mirroring traffic to a network analyzer.

title: Module 7: Wireless - Advanced WLANs
note: Cover advanced wireless concepts such as RF design, roaming, and configuring multiple SSIDs on a Wireless LAN Controller (WLC).

title: Wireless Security
note: Deep dive into securing wireless networks with WPA2/WPA3 and Enterprise authentication using 802.1X and a RADIUS server.

title: Module 8: Automation - Data Formats
note: Cover the data formats used in network automation: JSON for data exchange and YANG as a data modeling language.

title: APIs: REST and NETCONF/RESTCONF
note: Introduce the primary protocols for programmatic device interaction: REST APIs and the standardized NETCONF and RESTCONF protocols.

title: Configuration Management Tools
note: Provide an overview of Ansible, Puppet, and Chef for automating network infrastructure deployment and management.

title: Module 9: Final Project - Enterprise Network
note: Outline the final project: design and configure a multi-site enterprise network with redundant links, multiple routing protocols (EIGRP, OSPF, BGP), and advanced services in a simulator.

title: Final Project: Designing the Topology
note: Create a detailed network diagram and IP addressing plan for a headquarters site and two branch offices.

title: Final Project: IGP Configuration
note: Configure EIGRP and OSPF as the Interior Gateway Protocols within the different sites.

title: Final Project: BGP Configuration and Redistribution
note: Configure eBGP between the sites and redistribute the IGP routes into BGP, using route maps to control the process.

title: Module 10: Further Reading
note: Provide links to official Cisco documentation, white papers, and study resources for the CCNP concentration exams like ENARSI.
